formalpara.title: Movie 4
formalpara.para: Visualizing protrusive activity in wild-type embryos during dorsal intercalation using an lbp-1::gfp transcriptional reporter. Frames were acquired at 5 min. intervals. To suppress cell fusion, the strain was made homozygous for the eff-1(oj55) allele (Heid et al., 2001). Note the basolateral protrusions extended by the dorsal epidermal cells as they intercalate. The bright ovals are the nuclei of dorsal epidermal cells, which undergo a contralateral migration as intercalation proceeds. Anterior is to the left. Original spinning disc confocal movie footage courtesy of R. King.
